intro: Psychotria speluncae, commonly known as the cave psychotria, is a species of flowering plant native to the humid tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a small evergreen shrub that typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in cave systems and dense forests. The plant produces small, clustered white or pale pink flowers, which are often fragrant and attract various pollinators. Its leaves are usually elliptical and have a glossy surface, adapted to low-light conditions. Psychotria speluncae is part of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other species with similar ecological and medicinal significance.
